msItemStruct.note: Fragment A: Text is on one side only, 4 lines written against the fibers.
Fragment B: Text is on one side only, 5 lines written with the fibers.
Fragment C: Text is on both sides, 20 lines written against the fibers and 20 lines written with the fibers.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Ellen W. Harrison Collection.

supportDesc.support: Fragment A: 6.5 x 5.5 cm. All margins torn, but papyrus and ink in good state of preservation. Fragment B: 7 x 5.1 cm. All margins torn, some lacuna in lower half, and horizontal tearing at right edge. Ink badly preserved in first and third lines of text. Fragment C(1): roughly 6 x 21 cm. Top margin intact, all others torn with some small lacunae. Fragment C(2): roughly 7 x 12 cm. Bottom margin (?) intact, all others torn, with great damage to remainder of papyrus. Image may be scanned into SCETI inverted; if so, the intact margin is in fact the top of the text.

provenance.p: Purchased from Professor Moritz of Cairo, through W.M. Muller, 1910.

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
